## clickXPath() function

Clicks an element addressed by XPath atomically, e.g. within the same event loop run as finding it.

```javascript
await clickXPath(
    page, '//article[.//h1//text()[contains(., "My form")]]/button',
    {message: 'Could not find the button in the foobar form'}
);

```

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function clickXPath(page: Page, xpath: string, options?: RetryOptions & TimeoutOptions & VisibleOption & CheckEveryOption): Promise<void>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  page | Page | puppeteer page object. |
|  xpath | string | XPath selector to match the element. |
|  options | [RetryOptions](./pentf.retryoptions.md) &amp; [TimeoutOptions](./pentf.timeoutoptions.md) &amp; [VisibleOption](./pentf.visibleoption.md) &amp; [CheckEveryOption](./pentf.checkeveryoption.md) | Options |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;void&gt;
